com.phunware.core

Class PwCoreSession

  • com.phunware.core.PwCoreSession

  • public class PwCoreSession

    This class manages session start, stop and registration.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  PwCoreSession.Module 

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int SESSION_TIMER
      A session is stopped using PwCoreSession.activityStopSession. After this amount of time (in seconds), the session will expire.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PwCoreSession() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void activityStartSession()
      Start or persist a session. Call this on every Activity onStart() method. If a session doesn't exist, then a new session will be created. If a session was recently stopped using PwCoreSession.activityStopSession, then it can be resumed by calling this method before the session expires.

      RuntimeException will be thrown if PwCoreSession.registerKeys was not called first in android.app.Application#onCreate().
      void activityStopSession()
      Stop a session. Call this on every Activity onStop(). The session will be stopped and can be resumed by calling PwCoreSession.activityStartSession before the session expires.

      RuntimeException will be thrown if PwCoreSession.registerKeys was not called first in android.app.Application#onCreate().
      java.lang.String getAccessKey()
      Get the access key that was registered in one of the variations of PwCoreSession.registerKeys.
      java.lang.String getApplicationId()
      Get the application ID that was passed into PwCoreSession.registerKeys.
      java.lang.String getCoreBaseAnalyticsUrl() 
      java.lang.String getCoreBaseUrl() 
      java.lang.String getDeviceId()
      Do not use the below; use PwCoreSession.getSessionData.com.phunware.core.SessionData#getDeviceId() instead. Get the device ID.
      PwCoreSession.Environment getEnvironment()
      Getter for current core session environment
      java.lang.String getEnvironmentString()
      Debugging helper. Get an informational string based on currently installed modules.
      int getInstalledVersionCode()
      Return the application's version code.
      static PwCoreSession getInstance()
      Return an instance of PwCoreSession. This will provide a handle to be able to start and stop sessions.
      java.lang.String getLaasBaseUrl() 
      java.lang.String getModuleVersion()
      Gets the version number of the given module name. Accesses local storage.
      PwCoreSession.Module[] getModules()
      Gets all the modules (module name and version number) from the local storage
      SessionData getSessionData()
      Get the SessionData object.
      java.lang.String getSessionId()
      Get the current session ID. If there is no active session, null is returned.
      java.lang.String getSignatureKey()
      Get the signature key that was registered in one of the variations of PwCoreSession.registerKeys.
      void installModules()
      Install MaaS modules here. It must be called before making any additional calls to PwCoreSession, including PwCoreSession.registerKeys. This must be called in android.app.Application#onCreate() and should only be called once. Example usage: PwCoreSession.installModules(PwAlertsModule.getInstance(), ...);
      boolean isAppHasUpdated()
      Check if the app has started from an update.
      boolean isFreshInstall()
      Check if the app has started from a fresh installation.
      boolean isSessionStarted()
      Check if the session has been started.
      static void killSession()
      This will completely wipe out all session-related data, including keys. If this is called, PwCoreSession.registerKeys must be called again to start a new session. This should only be used for testing purposes.
      void registerKeys()
      This should be called after PwCoreSession.installModules and before making any additional calls to PwCoreSession. This must be called in android.app.Application#onCreate(). This performs initializations and setup that is required by other method calls. Use this in place of PwCoreSession.registerKeys if you choose to set the keys in the manifest. i.e.



      void registerKeys()
      This should be called after PwCoreSession.installModules and before making any additional calls to PwCoreSession. This must be called in android.app.Application#onCreate() if not using PwCoreSession.registerKeys. This performs initializations and setup that is required by other method calls.
      void registerKeys()
      This method has been deprecated in Core version 3.1 and above and will be removed shortly. Instead use PwCoreSession.registerKeys. Any value that is passed in to this method for encryption key will be ignored.
      void registerModule()
      Register a module and version
      void registerSDK() 
      void setEnvironment()
      This should be called before PwCoreSession#registerKeys(PwCoreSession, Context)

    • Field Detail

      • SESSION_TIMER

        public static int SESSION_TIMER

        A session is stopped using PwCoreSession.activityStopSession. After this amount of time (in seconds), the session will expire.

        See Also:
        PwCoreSession.activityStopSession

    • Constructor Detail

      • PwCoreSession

        public PwCoreSession()

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static PwCoreSession getInstance()

        Return an instance of PwCoreSession. This will provide a handle to be able to start and stop sessions.

        Returns:
        A MaaS Core session instance.
        See Also:
        PwCoreSession.activityStartSession, PwCoreSession.activityStopSession

      • killSession

        public static void killSession()

        This will completely wipe out all session-related data, including keys. If this is called, PwCoreSession.registerKeys must be called again to start a new session. This should only be used for testing purposes.

        See Also:
        PwCoreSession.registerKeys

      • activityStartSession

        public void activityStartSession()

        Start or persist a session. Call this on every Activity onStart() method.

        If a session doesn't exist, then a new session will be created. If a session was recently stopped using PwCoreSession.activityStopSession, then it can be resumed by calling this method before the session expires.

        RuntimeException will be thrown if PwCoreSession.registerKeys was not called first in android.app.Application#onCreate().

        See Also:
        PwCoreSession.activityStopSession, PwCoreSession.registerKeys

      • activityStopSession

        public void activityStopSession()

        Stop a session. Call this on every Activity onStop().

        The session will be stopped and can be resumed by calling PwCoreSession.activityStartSession before the session expires.

        RuntimeException will be thrown if PwCoreSession.registerKeys was not called first in android.app.Application#onCreate().

        See Also:
        PwCoreSession.activityStartSession, PwCoreSession.registerKeys

      • getAccessKey

        public java.lang.String getAccessKey()

        Get the access key that was registered in one of the variations of PwCoreSession.registerKeys.

        Returns:
        The access key.
        See Also:
        PwCoreSession.registerKeys

      • getApplicationId

        public java.lang.String getApplicationId()

        Get the application ID that was passed into PwCoreSession.registerKeys.

        Returns:
        The application ID.
        See Also:
        PwCoreSession.registerKeys

        public PwCoreSession.Module[] getModules()

        Returns:
        array of Module

      • getSignatureKey

        public java.lang.String getSignatureKey()

        Get the signature key that was registered in one of the variations of PwCoreSession.registerKeys.

        Returns:
        The signature key.
        See Also:
        PwCoreSession.registerKeys

      • getSessionId

        public java.lang.String getSessionId()

        Get the current session ID. If there is no active session, null is returned.

        Returns:
        The session ID or null if none is active.

      • getSessionData

        public SessionData getSessionData()

        Get the SessionData object.

        Returns:
        The session data.

      • getInstalledVersionCode

        public int getInstalledVersionCode()

        Return the application's version code.

        Returns:
        The installed application's version code.

      • isAppHasUpdated

        public boolean isAppHasUpdated()

        Check if the app has started from an update.

        Returns:
        True if the app is starting from an update.

      • isFreshInstall

        public boolean isFreshInstall()

        Check if the app has started from a fresh installation.

        Returns:
        True if the app is on a fresh install; false if not.

      • isSessionStarted

        public boolean isSessionStarted()

        Check if the session has been started.

        Returns:
        True if the session is started and running; false if not started or paused.

      • installModules

        public void installModules()

        Install MaaS modules here. It must be called before making any additional calls to PwCoreSession, including PwCoreSession.registerKeys. This must be called in android.app.Application#onCreate() and should only be called once. Example usage:

        PwCoreSession.installModules(PwAlertsModule.getInstance(), ...);

        See Also:
        PwCoreSession.registerKeys

      • setEnvironment

        public void setEnvironment()

        This should be called before PwCoreSession#registerKeys(PwCoreSession, Context)

      • getEnvironment

        public PwCoreSession.Environment getEnvironment()

        Getter for current core session environment

      • registerKeys

        public void registerKeys()

        This should be called after PwCoreSession.installModules and before making any additional calls to PwCoreSession. This must be called in android.app.Application#onCreate(). This performs initializations and setup that is required by other method calls.

        Use this in place of PwCoreSession.registerKeys if you choose to set the keys in the manifest.

        i.e.



        See Also:
        PwCoreSession.installModules, PwCoreSession.registerKeys

      • registerKeys

        public void registerKeys()

        This should be called after PwCoreSession.installModules and before making any additional calls to PwCoreSession. This must be called in android.app.Application#onCreate() if not using PwCoreSession.registerKeys. This performs initializations and setup that is required by other method calls.

        See Also:
        PwCoreSession.installModules, PwCoreSession.registerKeys

      • registerKeys

        public void registerKeys()

        This method has been deprecated in Core version 3.1 and above and will be removed shortly. Instead use PwCoreSession.registerKeys. Any value that is passed in to this method for encryption key will be ignored.

        See Also:
        PwCoreSession.registerKeys

      • getEnvironmentString

        public java.lang.String getEnvironmentString()

        Debugging helper. Get an informational string based on currently installed modules.

        Returns:
        A debug string.

      • getDeviceId

        public java.lang.String getDeviceId()

        Do not use the below; use PwCoreSession.getSessionData.com.phunware.core.SessionData#getDeviceId() instead. Get the device ID.

        Returns:
        The device ID string.
        See Also:
        PwCoreSession.getSessionData
